learning: Pair Codex automation definitions with a launchd-backed headless runner; DB updates alone do not execute schedules.
evidence: standup-summary remained overdue (next_run_at in past) until com.openai.codex.automation-runner LaunchAgent was installed; cron.py run-now changed next_run_at but did not create automation_runs entries by itself
application: For setup, always run scripts/install_launch_agent.sh after creating automations and verify with launchctl print + automation_runs rows.

learning: Launchd automation installers should be path-agnostic and idempotent; reruns must no-op cleanly when plist content and loaded service are unchanged.
evidence: install_launch_agent.sh run twice: first output 'installed and started', second output 'already installed and loaded'; launchd_wrapper.sh now derives automation_runner.py via dirname instead of hardcoded /Users path
application: For machine-portable Codex skills, compute script paths relative to script location and compare generated plist content before bootstrap/bootout.

learning: When vendored fisher state is lost, keep fish/fish_plugins committed and let update fall back to that manifest.
evidence: fish -c 'fisher update; echo fisher_status:0' moved from fish_plugins missing error to fisher_status:0 after adding fish/fish_plugins and fallback in fish/functions/fisher.fish.
application: For fish plugin-manager regressions in this repo, recover from fish_plugins first and make fisher update tolerant of missing _fisher_plugins vars.

learning: For cas scale-out, isolate instance state files and use 1 integrator + N read-only workers (sandboxPolicy=readOnly + decline file-change approvals) to avoid cross-instance collisions.
evidence: Added codex/skills/mesh/scripts/mesh_cas_fleet_autopilot.mjs with per-instance state_dir, worker sandboxPolicy=readOnly, fileApprovalDecision=decline, and integrator-only patch application.
application: When exceeding per-instance [agents].max_threads, run multiple cas instances but keep all integration (patch/validation/plan) in one integrator; workers produce diffs only.

learning: When renaming a skill invocation token, prefer token/metadata and doc-surface updates while preserving runtime wire identifiers unless explicitly requested.
evidence: Updated token references from $cas to $cas across AGENTS/mesh/puff docs, kept cas/request wire IDs and script filenames unchanged, and validated with rg no-match checks plus quick_validate.
application: For future skill renames, scope first to invocation token and terminology, then run targeted grep + quick_validate to confirm no stale references.

learning: For full namespace migrations, include hidden files in the verification pass (rg -uu excluding .git) after path+token renames to catch residual historical references.
evidence: Completed cas->cas migration across paths, runtime events, commands, and docs; initial codex-only grep was clean but hidden .learnings.jsonl still contained cas tokens until the -uu scan and cleanup.
application: When a user asks for all instances, run both repo-scope and hidden-file-inclusive scans before declaring zero residual references.

learning: For headless mesh CAS runners, preflight plan_file and emit deterministic headless stop telemetry (headless_stop_reason + delegation_did_not_run) when runtime capabilities cannot execute delegation.
evidence: Validated via uv quick_validate for codex/skills/mesh and node --check for both mesh CAS runner scripts after adding preflight/capability logs.
application: When updating mesh runtime adapters, add capability-state exits and actionable one-line stop messages before retry loops so automation fails closed instead of spinning.

learning: For cas_proxy state persistence under concurrent orchestration, use unique per-write temp filenames before rename; fixed '<state>.tmp' can trigger intermittent 'Failed to write state file' races.
evidence: Reproduced repeated state-write errors during mesh ready-task dry runs, then eliminated them after switching writeStateFile temp path to include pid+uuid; subsequent autopilot/fleet runs reported zero matches for 'Failed to write state file'.
application: When writing shared state files from async event handlers or multiple instances, avoid fixed temp names and prefer unique temp+atomic rename with best-effort cleanup.

learning: For mesh CAS runners under short turn budgets, combine timeout steer with thread/read reconciliation to avoid false timeout failures when completion lands after event-wait deadlines.
evidence: 120s dry-run previously emitted timeout failures while target turns were still active/completing later.
After adding steer + reconcile in CasClient and budget-aware prompts in runners, autopilot and fleet probes stopped emitting timeout-failure lines in completed validation runs.
application: When calling startTurnAndCollect in mesh runners, pass timeout steer options and reconcile the expected turn via thread/read before surfacing timeout.

learning: For mesh CAS runner one-shot executions (--once), enforce a 300000ms timeout floor and emit explicit clamp telemetry so dry-run budgets stay realistic and auditable.
evidence: Both autopilot and fleet now log mesh_timeout_clamp when requested timeout is 120000 with --once, then continue with headless preflight behavior.
application: Clamp --once timeout fields at process startup and log requested/applied/minimum values once before runner preflight.

learning: In mesh fleet worker orchestration, classify missing patch output separately from transport failure (no_diff_parsed/no_patch_returned vs no_response) and require explicit NO_DIFF:<reason> to reduce ambiguous has_diff=no outcomes.
evidence: After prompt+parser hardening, three observed worker attempts across fresh workspaces produced has_diff=yes parse_format=diff_fence with zero worker_no_diff lines in completed/partial evidence logs.
application: Use richer diff extraction + explicit no-diff contract in worker prompts and emit parse_format/failure_code telemetry for each attempt.

learning: For Zig parser guidance, pair SIMD delimiter bitmask scanning with explicit lane-bit ordering tests to prevent subtle index bugs.
evidence: uv run --with pyyaml -- python3 codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/scripts/quick_validate.py codex/skills/zig -> Skill is valid!
application: When adding SIMD scanning examples to codex/skills/zig/SKILL.md, include @bitCast mask iteration (@ctz/clear-lowest-bit) and document LSB->lane0 mapping.

learning: For mesh fleet confidence soaks, use per-run watchdog bounds and aggregate worker attempt/failure_code logs so no-diff reasoned failures are separated from no-response hangs.
evidence: 6-run bounded soak at /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T/mesh-fleet-soak.wolbF2 produced has_diff_yes=5, has_diff_no=2, worker_no_diff=1, fail_no_patch_returned=1, fail_no_response=0, watchdog_kill=2.
application: For mesh hardening validation, run isolated one-shot fleet waves with hard per-run watchdogs and report has_diff/no_diff/failure_code/parse_format totals from fleet logs.

learning: Fleet one-shot runs without external watchdog can end in no_diff_parsed fallback (run04/run05) and leave plan status pending, so this branch should trigger escalation/fallback telemetry distinct from no_patch_returned.
evidence: 5-run no-kill soak at /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T//mesh-fleet-debug-no-kill.xubL5Y had run04/run05 no_diff_parsed with plan_status=pending and run04/run05 mesh_fleet_integrator_fallback status=failed; run01-run03 had mixed completed/failed statuses.
application: Treat no_diff_parsed as terminal/failure path with explicit plan/trace handling rather than silent pending completion.

learning: When measuring prompt-hardening impact in mesh fleet, control for budget-mode worker gating () because integrator_solo runs suppress worker parse metrics and can hide parse_format regressions.
evidence: Baseline no-kill batch at /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T//mesh-fleet-debug-no-kill.xubL5Y had parse_none=8 and fail_no_diff_parsed=2 with no solo runs; tightened batch at /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T//mesh-fleet-debug-no-kill-tight.tEWS3Q had parse_none=0, fail_no_diff_parsed=0, and integrator_solo_start=2.
application: For A/B soak comparisons, segment results into worker-attempt runs vs integrator_solo runs before concluding prompt quality changes.

learning: Even with budget mode forced to all_out (worker_cap=1/1), fleet one-shot can still stall before or after first worker attempt; budget gating is not the only source of long-tail latency.
evidence: Controlled bounded rerun /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T//mesh-fleet-debug-tight-allout-bounded.GRPFX1: run01 logged worker_cap=1/1 and has_diff=yes parse_format=diff_fence but required watchdog_kill after 420s; run02 under same settings completed with mesh_fleet_integrated status=completed.
application: When debugging fleet reliability, separate budget-cap effects from CAS/thread latency by running all_out control batches and tracking preflight-to-attempt and attempt-to-integrated timings.

learning: Under fixed-cap all_out fleet runs with tightened worker output contract, parse_none/no_diff failure paths can drop to zero, but long-tail latency may still appear and should be bounded independently.
evidence: 5-run controlled bounded batch at /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T//mesh-fleet-tight-allout-bounded-v2.myhYtx completed with has_diff_yes=5, has_diff_no=0, worker_no_diff=0, fail_no_diff_parsed=0, fail_worker_turn_hang_before_output=0, integrated=5, solo_start=0, watchdog_kill=0.
application: Use all_out fixed-cap soaks to measure worker-output quality and keep separate watchdog controls for latency reliability claims.

learning: Use a test-only watchdog override env var to deterministically fault-inject worker hang classification without waiting for long natural stalls.
evidence: With MESH_CAS_TEST_WORKER_WATCHDOG_MS=1 on /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T/mesh-fault-inject-watchdog.NFWoeJ/run01, logs emitted mesh_fleet_worker_watchdog + mesh_fleet_worker_exhausted + mesh_fleet_worker_no_diff with failure_code=worker_turn_hang_before_output.
application: For mesh fleet reliability tests, set a tiny watchdog override and assert failure-code lines to verify hang handling paths end-to-end.

learning: The test-only worker watchdog override is inert when unset; normal all_out one-shot behavior remains unchanged and does not emit hang-classification lines.
evidence: Control run at /var/folders/8g/smldc3c95hlfp9_z2_47mx440000gn/T/mesh-control-no-override.5ELMw7 completed with has_diff_yes=1, integrated=1, watchdog_kill=0, worker_watchdog_lines=0, forced_hang_code_lines=0.
application: Keep MESH_CAS_TEST_WORKER_WATCHDOG_MS opt-in only for fault-injection tests; leave unset for production-like runs.

learning: Use account/rateLimits/read (longest window) to pace multi-agent fanout via delta=used%-elapsed% and tier-based concurrency clamps; allow explicit budget=all_out override.
evidence: node codex/skills/cas/scripts/cas_rate_limits.mjs --json --cwd /Users/tk/.dotfiles returned windowDurationMins=10080 usedPercent=17 elapsedPercent~1.6 tier=tight
application: When orchestrating with subagents or cas multi-instance, compute pace tier from account/rateLimits/read and clamp fanout/worker instances in budget=aware; skip clamps in budget=all_out.

learning: When account/rateLimits/read returns multiple windows, compute pacing/tier per window and enforce concurrency from the stricter effective tier instead of a longest-window-only decision.
evidence: node --input-type=module strictness harness passed: weekly-tight beats 5h-ahead and 5h-tight beats weekly-ahead in computeBudgetGovernor.
application: Keep budget governors multi-window aware so short-window saturation can throttle fanout even when weekly usage appears healthy.

learning: Resolve learnings scripts via HOME-based canonical paths instead of repo-relative codex/skills paths to avoid false non-vendored failures.
evidence: seq messages query found assistant error text: 'learnings recall path failed because this repo doesn’t vendor skill scripts' in 2026-02-17 session; validation command 'uv run python "/Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/learnings/scripts/learnings.py" datasets' succeeded from /tmp.
application: For recall/codify/append examples and orchestration prompts, use HOME-based resolver with fallback to /Users/tk/.codex/skills so commands work outside vendored-skill repos.

learning: Canonical skill path resolution should default to ~/.codex and only fallback to ~/.claude; never use ~/.dotfiles paths in runtime command examples.
evidence: Updated codex/AGENTS.md and codex/skills/learnings/SKILL.md commands to resolve from CODEX_HOME/.codex first, then CLAUDE_HOME/.claude fallback; live datasets command succeeded with new resolver.
application: For cross-agent skill invocations, set CODEX_SKILLS_HOME and CLAUDE_SKILLS_HOME, resolve scripts/specs from codex first, then claude if missing.

learning: Skill docs and runtime defaults should resolve skill paths via CODEX_HOME/.codex with CLAUDE_HOME/.claude fallback; avoid host-specific ~/.dotfiles paths.
evidence: Repository-wide scan found 42 ~/.dotfiles/codex/skills references across skill docs/scripts; after normalization, grep returned zero matches and quick_validate passed for puff/st/cas/mesh/seq.
application: When adding or editing skill-path commands, define SKILLS_HOME from CODEX_HOME first and fallback to CLAUDE_HOME, and use that variable in examples and script defaults.

learning: For ghost extractions with stateful workflows, fail-closed evidence bundles plus a verifier CLI close the gap between generic contract text and extraction-quality proof.
evidence: Added codex/skills/ghost/scripts/verify_evidence.py and wired required verification/evidence artifacts in SKILL.md + references/verification.md + references/templates.md; quick_validate passed.
application: Require verification/evidence artifacts and run verify_evidence.py before marking ghost extraction complete.

learning: Scope UV cache fallback to automation entrypoints by setting UV_CACHE_DIR defaults in launch wrappers/installers and long-running automation runners, instead of globally wrapping all uv usage.
evidence: Added UV_CACHE_DIR wiring in cron launchd wrapper/install script and mesh launch-agent installers plus mesh runner env defaults; bash/node syntax and quick_validate (cron, mesh) all passed.
application: For future automation hardening, prefer environment-level UV cache defaults at entrypoints so child codex/uv invocations inherit stable cache paths without touching non-automation workflows.

learning: For $seq feature additions, keep runtime dataset, SKILL.md examples, and agents/openai.yaml synchronized in one patch.
evidence: uv run /Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/seq/scripts/seq.py query --spec {"dataset":"memory_files","group_by":["category"],"metrics":[{"op":"count","as":"count"}],"sort":["-count"],"format":"table"} returned rollout_summaries=273, skills=7, root=4.
uv run --with pyyaml -- python3 codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/scripts/quick_validate.py /Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/seq returned Skill is valid!
application: When adding seq mining capabilities, patch scripts/seq.py + SKILL.md + agents/openai.yaml together, then run quick_validate before handoff.

learning: For seq prompt-search features, expose a first-class find-session command that returns both session_id and path so resume workflows are direct without extra parsing.
evidence: uv run /Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/seq/scripts/seq.py find-session --root ~/.codex/sessions --prompt "adapter=auto" --limit 3 --format table returned UUID-like session_id values
uv run --with pyyaml -- python3 codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/scripts/quick_validate.py codex/skills/seq returned Skill is valid!
application: When adding new seq retrieval workflows, include explicit session_id extraction and keep SKILL.md command examples in the same patch.

learning: For seq session-forensics asks, add a dedicated session-prompts command so users can list user-only prompts by default and optionally include assistant turns.
evidence: uv run /Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/seq/scripts/seq.py session-prompts --root ~/.codex/sessions --current --limit 5 returned indexed user prompt rows for the active session
uv run /Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/seq/scripts/seq.py session-prompts --root ~/.codex/sessions --current --strip-skill-blocks --limit 5 removed large <skill> payload rows
uv run --with pyyaml -- python3 /Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/scripts/quick_validate.py /Users/tk/.dotfiles/codex/skills/seq returned Skill is valid!
application: When a user asks for prompts from this session, run find-session if needed, then session-prompts --session-id <id> with --roles user,assistant only when both sides are requested.

learning: For seq token_deltas, use a total-only fast path when required fields only request delta_total_tokens to avoid generic tuple/dict materialization in the hot loop.
evidence: On ~/.codex/sessions/2025 with seq_perf_harness (--samples 6 --warmup 1), tokens-top-days mean improved 2.8026s -> 2.6819s (-4.30%) and token-usage mean improved 2.7175s -> 2.6027s (-4.22%), with frozen-root output parity checks passing for skills-rank/tokens-top-days/token-usage.
application: When required_fields collapse to one metric on high-volume scans, add a guarded specialized branch before generic extraction helpers.

learning: For learnings recall relevance, exclude context.paths from token overlap and scrub path-like substrings from evidence; when <=1 good match, append 1–2 high-impact guardrails.
evidence: uv run python codex/skills/learnings/scripts/learnings.py recall --query "mesh fleet timeout" --limit 5 --drop-superseded returned only mesh-related items (no ghost/path_resolution matches).
uv run python codex/skills/learnings/scripts/learnings.py recall --query "zzzxqwyv-not-a-real-topic" --limit 5 --drop-superseded returned fallback high-impact items with score=0.000.
application: In cmd_recall, tokenize only learning/application/tags + evidence (paths scrubbed); keep paths only for explicit path_match boosts.

learning: For tk usage telemetry, mention counts are dominated by orchestration worker prompts; strict-output worker override should be explicit, and $tk mention text alone is not proof of template execution.
evidence: seq occurrence-export for tk: 136 total mentions; 65 worker-prompt snippets; 53 mention PATCH-FIRST; 32 mention unified diff or NO_DIFF.
application: When refining tk, keep full TK structure as default and add an explicit adapter mode for artifact-only worker contracts.

learning: For seq guidance, use binary-first with brew-aware bootstrap and keep uv Python fallback for non-brew platforms.
evidence: Updated codex/skills/seq/SKILL.md quick-start run_seq wrapper and codex/AGENTS.md seq guardrail commands; uv run --with pyyaml -- python3 codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/scripts/quick_validate.py codex/skills/seq passed.
application: When documenting seq commands, include command -v seq detection, optional brew install attempt on Darwin with brew present, then uv Python fallback.

learning: For Zig CLI Homebrew formulas, include bin.mkpath before zig build-exe and assert help markers with '2>&1' because many Zig CLIs print --help to stderr.
evidence: brew install tkersey/tap/cas initially failed with 'unable to open output directory .../bin'; after adding bin.mkpath installs succeeded.
brew test tkersey/tap/cas initially failed expecting cas_smoke_check.zig in stdout; after switching tests to '--help 2>&1' both cas/lift tests passed.
application: When adding Zig CLIs to Homebrew tap formulas, create bin dir explicitly and capture stderr in test assertions for help output.

learning: For Puppeteer CDP target filtering, include target type 'tab' with 'browser' and 'page'; omitting 'tab' can break newPage/active-tab flows with 30s timeouts.
evidence: Applying filter browser+page in web-browser tools caused nav.js --new and bench-all to timeout; widening to browser+tab+page restored behavior.
Microbench showed connect p95 improved from 13.609ms to 11.566ms after using browser+tab+page targetFilter.
application: When optimizing Puppeteer connect overhead, validate target types observed at connect-time and keep behavioral probes for newPage and active-tab lookups.

learning: For hard-cut role renames in mesh orchestration, update runtime flags, telemetry labels, installer flags, and docs in one pass or the fleet runner drifts.
evidence: Validated renamed runtime/help surfaces with node codex/skills/mesh/scripts/mesh_cas_fleet_autopilot.mjs --help 2>&1 and bash codex/skills/mesh/scripts/install_mesh_cas_fleet_autopilot_launch_agent.sh --help, and confirmed no integrator tokens remain under codex via rg.
application: When renaming orchestration roles, treat script options, launch-agent installer args, telemetry keys, and docs as a single atomic rename unit with grep/help proof.

learning: For cloud operators that delegate to gh-only skills, put auth preflight in both the skill contract and the generated operator prompt to fail fast deterministically.
evidence: Added Auth preflight section to codex/skills/join/SKILL.md and mirrored gh auth/repo checks plus auth_unavailable fail-fast rule in codex/skills/join/assets/cloud-join-operator-prompt.md.
application: When adding cloud wrappers around gh-bound skills, enforce the same auth preflight at contract and prompt layers before any routing/mutation logic.

learning: For custom subagent renames, rename both the [agents.<name>] keys and config_file targets in codex/config.toml in the same change as the .toml file rename.
evidence: uv run python validation asserted coder/joiner present and implementer/join absent in codex/config.toml and existing config_file targets.
application: When renaming custom agent roles, treat config keys plus file paths as one atomic migration to avoid unknown-agent or missing-file runtime errors.

learning: For multi-skill Zig migrations, ship delegating Zig CLIs first and enforce brew marker checks so command routing is reliable before deeper native rewrites.
evidence: zig build build-cron/build-puff/build-learnings passed in skills-zig and help markers cron.zig/puff.zig/learnings.zig/append_learning.zig verified.
quick_validate passed for codex/skills/cron, codex/skills/puff, and codex/skills/learnings after bootstrap helper updates.
application: When migrating script-first skills, combine Homebrew-first marker-validated dispatch in docs with Zig wrapper binaries that preserve script parity via delegation.

learning: When validating newly published git-tag Homebrew formulas after local proof installs, clear formula git caches before reinstall to avoid stale-source false negatives.
evidence: tkersey/tap installs initially failed with 'no step named build-cron' until ~/Library/Caches/Homebrew/{cron,puff,learnings}--git were removed and installs rerun.
After cache cleanup, brew install --build-from-source tkersey/tap/{cron,puff,learnings} succeeded at 0.1.0.
application: In release verification, add a cache-reset step between local proof-tap runs and public-tap install checks.

learning: For lift skill updates, lock Zig CLI behavior and marker proof before syncing Python/Node wrappers to preserve contract parity.
evidence: uv run --with pyyaml -- python3 codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/scripts/quick_validate.py codex/skills/lift -> Skill is valid!
seq query shows 16 user dollar mentions for lift plus recent requests to prove zig CLI usage.
application: When refining lift workflows, keep Zig-first sequencing explicit and require wrapper convergence after Zig proof.

learning: For multi-agent coding teams, keep coder authoring-only and move reducer/feedback/fixer responsibilities into separate agent contracts to avoid role blur and authority drift.
evidence: uv run python config validation confirmed dedicated coder/reducer/fixer/feedback entries and files exist; st tasks st-001..st-004 completed with dependency gating.
application: When evolving subagent teams, define one role per contract file and encode safety authority in fixer instead of overloading coder instructions.

learning: When hardening mesh reliability docs, keep runtime failure codes and reference taxonomy synchronized and validate with both quick_validate and worker-output smoke checks.
evidence: uv run quick_validate passed for codex/skills/mesh and mesh_worker_output_smoke.mjs returned ok cases=8 after adding failure-taxonomy/completion-gates/team-protocol/adjudication-fallback/coder-rubric references.
application: For future mesh contract updates, require doc/runtime parity checks and smoke validation before closing st wave status.

learning: When retiring cross-skill command ownership, remove the command surface from the old skill entirely and update docs/prompts/references in the same change to prevent stale invocation guidance.
evidence: Removed puff cas-start/cas-stop command handlers from puff.sh and cleaned puff SKILL.md, references/commands.md, and agents/openai.yaml to direct users to cas.
application: For future ownership moves, pair command deletion with quick_validate + help-surface grep to confirm no stale command names remain.

learning: $select scoring should rank by risk/hardness/blast before priority when resolving conflicting ready tasks.
evidence: Updated codex/skills/select/SKILL.md tie-break section and validated with uv run --with pyyaml python .../quick_validate.py (Skill is valid!).
application: When refining selector logic, prefer composite scoring over priority-only ordering to reduce risky picks and preserve parallelism quality.

learning: When a user asks for staged delivery, keep related skill edits and skill deletion as two separate commits with separate pushes.
evidence: Created/pushed d473e49 for $select scoring update, then created/pushed 60bdf69 deleting codex/skills/slice/SKILL.md.
application: For repo skill lifecycle changes, preserve explicit two-phase commit boundaries to make rollback and review simpler.
